content:
• Monday, April 29, 2013
  • RGR

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (NYSE:RGR): Move up in the post session after posting a solid Q1 earnings...

    Shares of Sturm Ruger (NYSE:RGR): Move up in the post session after posting a solid Q1 earnings beat. Net earnings grew 53% Y/Y, driven by a 39% jump in sales, which in turn were driven by by the introduction of the new LC380 and SR45 pistols. Shares +2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 PM
  • MBI

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI) sinks 5.5% AH after it fails to win summary judgement against Bank of America's...

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI) sinks 5.5% AH after it fails to win summary judgement against Bank of America's (NYSE:BAC) Countrywide unit in a lawsuit over whether the bank breached its obligations to repurchase loans. Attorney Christian Herzeca notes the judge found each point of law in MBIA's favor, but as "sufficient facts remain in dispute," a trial is necessary.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • ESRX

    More on Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX): Q1 results beat across the board as revenue more than...

    More on Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX): Q1 results beat across the board as revenue more than doubled Y/Y. Net earnings rose 39% as the pharmacy-benefit manager's revenue surged, helped by its Medco acquisition. Gross margin widened to 7.5% from 6.9%, including retail pharmacy co-payments. The company raises its full-year earnings outlook by $0.03 a share, now seeing its EPS coming in at $4.23 to $4.33. Shares +2.1% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:31 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLBS

    NeoStem (NBS) announces a public offering, saying it intends to use the proceeds for working...

    NeoStem (NBS) announces a public offering, saying it intends to use the proceeds for working capital, including research and development of cell therapeutic product candidates, including AMR-001, plus expansion of its business units, strategic transactions and other general corporate purposes. Terms and size of the offering have not yet been disclosed. Aegis Capital is acting as sole book-running manager. Shares -8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:40 PM | 3 Comments
  • HTWR

    More on HeartWare International (NASDAQ:HTWR): Q1 beats across the board on an 87% jump in total...

    More on HeartWare International (NASDAQ:HTWR): Q1 beats across the board on an 87% jump in total sales. Net losses narrowed on U.S. sales of its implantable heart pumps. The company sold a record 482 HVAD pumps globally in the latest period, up from 298 units in Q112 and surpassing its previous high quarterly total of 345 in Q412. Gross margin widened to 61.9% from 58.9%. Shares +7.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:19 PM
  • HTWR

    HeartWare International (NASDAQ:HTWR): Q1 EPS loss of $0.87 beats by $0.33. Revenue of $49.2M...

    HeartWare International (NASDAQ:HTWR): Q1 EPS loss of $0.87 beats by $0.33. Revenue of $49.2M (+87% Y/Y) beats by $9.2M. (PR) Shares +7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:13 PM
  • OIS

    Oil States International (NYSE:OIS) +7.1% AH on news activist hedge fund Jana Partners has taken...

    Oil States International (NYSE:OIS) +7.1% AH on news activist hedge fund Jana Partners has taken a 9.1% stake (~5M shares) in the company. The firm held no shares at the end of the December quarter. Jana is fresh off a defeat in its attempt to elect a group of dissident nominees to Agrium's board.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM
  • QRVO

    TriQuint (TQNT) +3.1% AH after activist investor Starboard Value discloses a 7.82% stake in the...

    TriQuint (TQNT) +3.1% AH after activist investor Starboard Value discloses a 7.82% stake in the RF component maker. TriQuint has been losing share in recent years (sales fell 15% Y/Y in Q1, though they're expected to grow 6% in Q2), and has been struggling to turn a profit, something that generally hasn't been a problem for rivals Skyworks and RF Micro. Shares rallied last week thanks to better-than-feared Q2 guidance. (13D)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:50 PM
  • HTWR

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: HTWR +9%. TXRH +8%. MGT +3%. USLV +3%. BWLD +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: HTWR +9%. TXRH +8%. MGT +3%. USLV +3%. BWLD +2%.
    After-hours top losers: MCO -8%. RVBD -7%. NSPR -7%. MBI -6%. BAH -3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • NEM

    More on Newmont Mining's (NYSE:NEM) Q1 results: Average consolidated costs applicable to...

    More on Newmont Mining's (NYSE:NEM) Q1 results: Average consolidated costs applicable to sales were $758/oz. of gold, vs. $620 a year earlier and $740 consensus. Attributable gold production fell 11% Y/Y to 1.17M oz., while attributable copper output grew 9% to 38M lbs. Lowers full-year attributable and consolidated capex outlooks by $100M each to $2B-$2.2B and $2.3B-$2.5B, respectively. Shares -1.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 2 Comments
  • APL

    Atlas Pipeline (NYSE:APL): Q1 EPS of -$0.48. Revenue of $407.9M misses by $31.5M. Shares -3.7%...

    Atlas Pipeline (NYSE:APL): Q1 EPS of -$0.48. Revenue of $407.9M misses by $31.5M. Shares -3.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:12 PM
  • HYGS

    Hydrogenics (NASDAQ:HYGS) announces its intent to offer shares in an underwritten public...

    Hydrogenics (NASDAQ:HYGS) announces its intent to offer shares in an underwritten public offering. The size and terms of the offering have not been disclosed. Roth Capital is acting as the sole manager for the offering. Shares -5.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • NTI

    Northern Tier Energy (NYSE:NTI) -3.9% AH after announcing a public offering of 10M common units...

    Northern Tier Energy (NYSE:NTI) -3.9% AH after announcing a public offering of 10M common units representing interests held by Northern Tier Holdings LLC; NTI will receive no proceeds from the offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:07 PM
  • NEM

    Newmont Mining (NYSE:NEM): Q1 EPS of $0.71 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $2.18B misses by $0.3B....

    Newmont Mining (NYSE:NEM): Q1 EPS of $0.71 misses by $0.09. Revenue of $2.18B misses by $0.3B. Shares -1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:02 PM
  • WAIR

    Wesco Aircraft (NYSE:WAIR): FQ2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $225.9M (+24% Y/Y) beats...

    Wesco Aircraft (NYSE:WAIR): FQ2 EPS of $0.33 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $225.9M (+24% Y/Y) beats by $11.9M. Shares +3.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • NYMT

    New York Mortgage Trust (NASDAQ:NYMT) announces a big 13.6M share secondary - together with the...

    New York Mortgage Trust (NASDAQ:NYMT) announces a big 13.6M share secondary - together with the underwriters option, it will add about 30% to the float. The company estimates Q1 GAAP income of $0.28-$0.31/share which includes $0.12-$0.15 of unrealized gains thanks to narrowing credit spreads on its book of multi-family loans. March 31 book value/share is estimated at $6.53-$6.56. Shares -5% AH to $7.01.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM | 4 Comments
  • FEN

    First Trust Energy Income & Growth Fund (NYSEMKT:FEN) -2.5% AH after commencing a public...

    First Trust Energy Income & Growth Fund (NYSEMKT:FEN) -2.5% AH after commencing a public offering of 2.5M common shares. FEN says net proceeds will be used to make additional portfolio investments consistent with its investment objective and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • CYH

    Community Health (NYSE:CYH): Q1 EPS of $0.87 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $3.31B (+0.4% Y/Y)...

    Community Health (NYSE:CYH): Q1 EPS of $0.87 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $3.31B (+0.4% Y/Y) misses by $0.07B. Shares +1.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • HIG

    Hartford Financial (NYSE:HIG): Q1 EPS of $0.92 beats by $0.10. Shares -3.3% AH.

    Hartford Financial (NYSE:HIG): Q1 EPS of $0.92 beats by $0.10. Shares -3.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • TXRH

    Texas Roadhouse (NASDAQ:TXRH): Q1 EPS of $0.37 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $359.6M (+11% Y/Y)...

    Texas Roadhouse (NASDAQ:TXRH): Q1 EPS of $0.37 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $359.6M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $1.95M. Shares +7.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • DTLK

    Datalink (NASDAQ:DTLK): Q1 EPS of $0.18 in-line. Revenue of $133.6M (+12% Y/Y) beats by $1.54M....

    Datalink (NASDAQ:DTLK): Q1 EPS of $0.18 in-line. Revenue of $133.6M (+12% Y/Y) beats by $1.54M. Shares +8.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • HLF

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q1 EPS of $1.27 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $1.12B beats by $0.01B. Shares...

    Herbalife (NYSE:HLF): Q1 EPS of $1.27 beats by $0.21. Revenue of $1.12B beats by $0.01B. Shares -3.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 4 Comments
  • RVBD

    Riverbed Technology (NASDAQ:RVBD): Q1 EPS of $0.23 in-line. Revenue of $253M (+38% Y/Y) misses...

    Riverbed Technology (NASDAQ:RVBD): Q1 EPS of $0.23 in-line. Revenue of $253M (+38% Y/Y) misses by $8.25M. Shares -12.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q1 EPS of $0.87 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $304.4M (+21% Y/Y) beats...

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD): Q1 EPS of $0.87 misses by $0.12. Revenue of $304.4M (+21% Y/Y) beats by $0.5M. Shares -2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • ESRX

    Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX): Q1 EPS of $0.99 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $26.0B beats by...

    Express Scripts (NASDAQ:ESRX): Q1 EPS of $0.99 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $26.0B beats by $0.46B. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • EYPT

    pSivida (PSDV +5%) gains today after its licensee Alimera Sciences (ALIM -3.2%) says Iluvien,...

    pSivida (PSDV +5%) gains today after its licensee Alimera Sciences (ALIM -3.2%) says Iluvien, its treatment for chronic diabetic macular edema, is now available in the UK for treatment of private pay and privately insured patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • LNG

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +3.1%) has remained strong all day after morning rumors that it may be...

    Cheniere Energy (LNG +3.1%) has remained strong all day after morning rumors that it may be exploring a potential LBO and rumored premium averages of ~25%. Such rumors have been around before, and Jim Cramer thinks they're "ridiculous."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 11 Comments
  • AUXL

    Shares of Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL -12.8%) take a big hit today on a disappointing Q1...

    Shares of Auxilium Pharmaceuticals (AUXL -12.8%) take a big hit today on a disappointing Q1 report, missing on both EPS and revenue. The company cites some some "unanticipated challenges" with its commercial franchises for the miss. For FY13, its expects revenues of $360M - $415M, which reflects the closing of the acquisition of Actient, and may not be comparable to consensus estimates of $334.34M.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLF

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +4.1%) is moving higher today, but KeyBanc expects the stock to...

    Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF +4.1%) is moving higher today, but KeyBanc expects the stock to remain static ~$20 given its bearish view about iron ore prices, driven by the expectation of large new projects to hit the global market during 2013-15; the firm believes as long as this view remains dominant, CLF shares "will lack any meaningful upside catalyst" despite strong measures to improve liquidity.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • HNT

    Health Net (HNT +4.8%) trades up today after its Q1 came in better than expected. The company...

    Health Net (HNT +4.8%) trades up today after its Q1 came in better than expected. The company swung to a net profit during the quarter, as lower expenses helped to offset declining health-plan enrollment and revenue. The company also forecast its EPS to come in better than Street estimates, now seeing FY13 earnings of around $2.20 to $2.30 a share on revenue of between $10.7B and $11.2B. Analysts expected $2.07 a share on $11.32B in revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • NIHD

    NII Holdings (NIHD +6.1%) has another big day after Wells Fargo's Jennifer Fritzsche upgrades...

    NII Holdings (NIHD +6.1%) has another big day after Wells Fargo's Jennifer Fritzsche upgrades shares to Outperform: She thinks the Latin American carrier could get a higher-than-expected bid for its wireless tower assets, which are on the block, and sees its Mexican and Brazilian positions improving. NII took off on Friday after announcing it's selling its Peruvian ops for $400M. An enormous 46.1% of the float was shorted as of April 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • GOLD

    More on Citi's review of gold mining stocks: On Buy-rated Barrick (ABX +3.4%), the firm believes...

    More on Citi's review of gold mining stocks: On Buy-rated Barrick (ABX +3.4%), the firm believes liquidity concerns at $1,400/oz. gold are misplaced since ABX already has announced $600M in spending cuts, plans to issue new long-term debt to address near-term maturities, and continues to negotiate non-core asset sales. Citi also keeps a Buy on Kinross (KGC -2.2%) because of the growth offered by the Tasiast project.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 5 Comments
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +5.6%) rally again in a move that looks and smells suspiciously...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +5.6%) rally again in a move that looks and smells suspiciously like a squeeze of more shorts. The last official word from Nasdaq was that Tesla's short interest was 30.695M shares on April 15 - down from 32.317M on March 15 - with another report out in a few days which could clear up the issue even more.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM | 11 Comments
  • LPNT

    Another hospital stock on the move today after an upgrade: LifePoint Hospitals (LPNT +4.6%). The...

    Another hospital stock on the move today after an upgrade: LifePoint Hospitals (LPNT +4.6%). The shares are up strongly after UBS takes the stock to Buy from Neutral. (See also: Upgrades, reimbursement hike fuel hospital stocks & LPNT rises on mixed Q1 report)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • CREE

    LED stocks outperform as the Energy Savings and Industrial Competitiveness Act gets introduced...

    LED stocks outperform as the Energy Savings and Industrial Competitiveness Act gets introduced in the Senate. The bill, which provides incentives and mandates to get the federal government and businesses to adopt energy-saving technologies, doesn't feature loan program provisions that had led prior bills to draw heat from Congressional Republicans. Last year, Pres. Obama authorized $2B in spending on energy efficiency upgrades for federal buildings. CREE +2.4%. LEDS +15.9%. RBCN +2.2%. GTAT +6.8%. (bill text) (summary)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • BB

    Early signs from the U.K. Q10 launch are "very very good" and BlackBerry (BBRY +3.1%) foresees...

    Early signs from the U.K. Q10 launch are "very very good" and BlackBerry (BBRY +3.1%) foresees "several tens of millions" in Q10 sales altogether, says Thorsten Heins in a Bloomberg TV appearance (video). Given BlackBerry's own sales figures as well as 3rd-party forecasts, he might be getting ahead of himself. Meanwhile, RBC has raised its May quarter BB10 shipment forecast to 2.75M from 2M, citing signs of "pent-up demand" for the Q10. (Jefferies report)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:16 PM | 24 Comments
  • CENX

    Century Aluminum (CENX +11.3%) says it has reached an agreement to obtain market price power for...

    Century Aluminum (CENX +11.3%) says it has reached an agreement to obtain market price power for a smelter in Hawesville, Kentucky. Also, CENX says it will acquire the assets of another smelter (Sebree) in the state for $61M from a subsidiary of Rio Tinto Alcan. The Sebree smelter, like its counterpart in Hawesville, "is globally competitive in every area other than the cost of power." The company hopes to make both facilities more viable by obtaining cheaper energy. Finally, Davenport upgrades the shares to Buy from Neutral and doubles its price target to $14.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM
  • GWAY

    Greenway Medical (GWAY -19%) falls as investors react negatively to the company's revised...

    Greenway Medical (GWAY -19%) falls as investors react negatively to the company's revised guidance for FY13. GWAY says it now sees a GAAP net loss of $0.11-0.13 per share on revenue of $132-134M. In February, the company said it expected to earn $0.10-0.17 per share on revenues $145-150M. For its part, the Street is expecting $0.22 per share on sales of $146.7M.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:30 PM | 1 Comment
  • LAS

    Chinese auto retailer Lentuo International (LAS -31.3%) plunges after reporting quarterly...

    Chinese auto retailer Lentuo International (LAS -31.3%) plunges after reporting quarterly earnings. In short, there wasn't much to like in the numbers: on a Y/Y basis, revenues fell 15.4%, vehicles sold decreased 12.8%, vehicles serviced fell 4.6% and the company reported a net loss of $3.9M compared to a net profit in the comparable quarter of 2011. "Our business continued to face significant challenges in Q4," LAS' chairman noted dryly. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • SNH

    Red-hot Senior Housing Properties Trust (SNH -2.3%) takes a breather after reporting about...

    Red-hot Senior Housing Properties Trust (SNH -2.3%) takes a breather after reporting about inline FFO of $0.43 for Q1, off $0.02 from a year ago. The company purchased 4 properties in the quarter for about $75M, plus the assumption of $12.3B in mortgage debt. Two more properties went under contract in April, each for more than $20M. A senior community in Pittsburgh is currently being offered for sale by SNH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • CRUS

    As goes Apple, so goes Cirrus Logic (CRUS +7.1%). The audio codec chipmaker is taking off in...

    As goes Apple, so goes Cirrus Logic (CRUS +7.1%). The audio codec chipmaker is taking off in sympathy with the customer than made up 85% of its March quarter revenue, one trading day after getting clocked due to downbeat remarks about FY14 sales. Likewise, iPhone/Galaxy S4 supplier Skyworks (SWKS +3.4%) is rallying following a post-earnings Friday decline caused by mixed guidance, and so is rival RF Micro (RFMD +3.2%). Broadcom (BRCM +2.5%), meanwhile, is adding to last week's strong post-earnings gains, fueled by a Q1 beat and solid guidance. The gains come even as another Apple supplier, Nam Tai, gets crushed due to weak guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • OSHWQ

    Midday top 10 gainers: OSH +43%. WRLS +31%. CPTS + 19%. MDSO +20%. GALT +19%. LEDS +18%. FXEN...

    Midday top 10 gainers: OSH +43%. WRLS +31%. CPTS + 19%. MDSO +20%. GALT +19%. LEDS +18%. FXEN +17%. OSBC +14%. PRGN +12%. CCH +12%.
    Midday top 10 losers: LAS -31%. NTE -28%. HGSH -20%. GWAY -19%. LXRX -18%. FVE -15%. AUXL -11%. MLP -10%. CETV -10%. BIOL -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • FXEN

    FX Energy (FXEN +15.7%) says gas flowed at its Tuchola-3K well in Poland at a rate of ~5M cubic...

    FX Energy (FXEN +15.7%) says gas flowed at its Tuchola-3K well in Poland at a rate of ~5M cubic feet of gas per day on a drill stem test. FXEN has not yet determined if the well is commercial but is "cautiously optimistic" and will conduct a full production test within days and consider additional wells to appraise the area’s potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • DB

    More on Deutsche Bank (DB +0.3%): The capital raise news comes as the bank reports Q1 EPS of...

    More on Deutsche Bank (DB +0.3%): The capital raise news comes as the bank reports Q1 EPS of €1.71 on revenues of €9.4B. Cost cutting: Noninterest expense of €6.6B down 5% Y/Y. Current Basel 3 Tier 1 capital ratio of 8.8% would be hiked to about 9.5% after the €2.8B share sale. Giving in? Three months ago, new co-CEO Anshu Jain pledged no share issuance. "We don't think it's in our shareholders best interest for us to issue capital given our discount to book value." Shares are 16% lower today than at that point.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • LAYN

    Layne Christensen (LAYN +5.7%) trades up today on the back of a report in Barron's over the...

    Layne Christensen (LAYN +5.7%) trades up today on the back of a report in Barron's over the weekend saying that the stock's recent selloff looks overdone. Profit is likely to pick up next year as the company sheds the overhang of legacy contracts in its Heavy Civil business unit, and its mining business picks back up. The stock is currently trading at a 14% discount to book value, and Boenning & Scattergood's Gerard Sweeney thinks they could soon return to the low $20s.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • LGF.A

    Shares of Lion's Gate (LGF +2.7%) continue their upward trek with more enthusiasm over the...

    Shares of Lion's Gate (LGF +2.7%) continue their upward trek with more enthusiasm over the studio's pipeline helping to tip sentiment. Though analysts are quick to note the company has more than the Twilight and Hunger Games franchises to bank on, the 24.255M views on YouTube for the sneak peek at the new The Hunger Games: Catching Fire movie (still seven months from debuting) is a good indication what all the buzz is about. (trailer)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:39 PM
  • DB

    Deutsche Bank (DB -1.6%) gives in, hatching plans to raise capital by issuing €2.8B in...

    Deutsche Bank (DB -1.6%) gives in, hatching plans to raise capital by issuing €2.8B in shares, and potentially another €2B of subordinated debt over the next year. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • GALT

    Shares of Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +20%) are on a tear today after the company released...

    Shares of Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +20%) are on a tear today after the company released pre-clinical test results of the drugs GR-MD-02 and GM-CT-01, which were found to reverse the most advanced stage of liver cirrhosis, as well as reduction in portal hypertension in animal experiments. The results are seen as demonstrating an important pathophysiological effect of cirrhosis, and show encouraging potential for future human studies.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • PBR

    After reporting a 4% Q/Q decline in crude oil output due to ongoing maintenance shutdowns at...

    After reporting a 4% Q/Q decline in crude oil output due to ongoing maintenance shutdowns at aging offshore platforms, Petrobras (PBR +6.6%) expects crude oil production to surge in 2014 as it ramps up output on seven new production platforms to be installed this year. Maintenance work will continue to undercut output in Q2 before picking up in H2. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • ROP

    Roper Industries (ROP -3.2%) slips on a mixed Q1 report today. Net earnings rose 15% Y/Y on...

    Roper Industries (ROP -3.2%) slips on a mixed Q1 report today. Net earnings rose 15% Y/Y on solid sales growth out of its medical and scientific-imaging business and RF-technology unit, offsetting declines in its industrial-technology and energy systems-and-controls divisions. Operating margin increased 1.1% to 25.1%. The company raised EPS estimates for the year to reflect its pending acquisition of Managed Health Care Associates. It now expects to earn between $5.76 to $5.94 per share, versus its earlier view of $5.60 to $5.82.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • EXPE

    The post-earnings hangover continues with Expedia (EXPE -4.2%) as share slip below the $56 mark...

    The post-earnings hangover continues with Expedia (EXPE -4.2%) as share slip below the $56 mark for the first time in close to six months. Though the company has seen its revenue grow roughly in-line with peers, profits haven't caught up yet. (more on EXPE: earnings call transcript, Goldman Sachs' take)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:37 AM
  • YOKU

    Chinese Internet stocks rally following news Alibaba is buying an 18% stake in Sina as it tries...

    Chinese Internet stocks rally following news Alibaba is buying an 18% stake in Sina as it tries to head off competition from Tencent. Youku (YOKU +7%) is the biggest winner, but Baidu (BIDU +2.2%), NetQin (NQ +3.8%), NetEase (NTES +2%), and YY (YY +3.7% - a rival to Tencent's QQ platform) are also having good days. Youku filed its 2012 20-F on Friday.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • AAPL

    As Apple (AAPL +2.5%) surges above $425, a French site leaks an apparent sales doc for Japanese...

    As Apple (AAPL +2.5%) surges above $425, a French site leaks an apparent sales doc for Japanese carrier KDDI that states iPhone 5S pre-sales will start on June 20 (shortly after the WWDC conference) ahead of a July launch. The doc also claims the 5S will have a 13MP camera and fingerprint reader. It's possible the launch info is dated - there have been multiple reports the 5S launch has been pushed back to Aug./Sep. from July. Also: KGI Securities, which has a pretty good track record, reports new MacBook Pro/Air models will arrive at WWDC, and that display yield issues will likely push back retina iPad Mini mass-production to October. (S-3 filing)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM | 7 Comments
  • BAYRY

    In an effort to broaden its women's contraceptive offerings, Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY +0.4%) has...

    In an effort to broaden its women's contraceptive offerings, Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY +0.4%) has agreed to buy Conceptus (CPTS +19.5%) for around $1.1B. The company says that within the next 10 business days it will launch a tender offer to acquire all of CPTS's stock at $31, a 20% premium to Friday's close. The deal is expected to close by middle of the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +6.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $28 price target (from $23) at BAML...

Though a 41%-44% Y/Y increase in brand ad revenue, and a 58%-65% jump in Sogou search revenue, is expected to boost sales, Sohu's aggressive spending  - opex +40% Y/Y in Q1 - clearly isn't letting up. Sohu's online game revenue is expected to hit $165M-$170M in Q2, up from Q2 2012's $137M. Changyou expects Q2 revenue of $170M-$185M and EPS of $1.33-$1.38 vs. a consensus of $179.4M and $1.43. (PRs: I, II)

Also: Morgan Stanley has resumed coverage on MetroPCS with an Equal-Weight.

    Sina's (NASDAQ:SINA) partnership with Alibaba, long rumored, is aimed at Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY):...

    Sina's (NASDAQ:SINA) partnership with Alibaba, long rumored, is aimed at Tencent (OTCPK:TCEHY): the company's WeChat mobile IM platform has become a serious rival to Weibo, and its e-commerce sales rose 49% Y/Y in Q4 to $273M. Last month, Tencent announced plans to merge its QQ Mall and QQ Buy e-commerce sites to better take on Alibaba, and 2 weeks ago, it announced e-commerce integration for WeChat. Tencent has also launched an online payments service that competes with Alibaba's dominant Alipay and Sina's WeiboPay; the latter might now get shuttered. Alibaba's 18% stake gives Yahoo (YHOO) an indirect 4.3% stake in Sina, and Sina promises the deal will produce $380M in revenue over the next 3 years.
